ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] LEHP!
ygData.msgSnippet: Yup, thats exactly whats been happening!!!! Sucks really bad :) Btw, Gorenaire is a really mean dragon =/ Halana, 57th Shaman Tani 33rd Bardette Paradigm 0,
ygData.messageBody:
Yup, thats exactly whats been happening!!!! Sucks really bad :)

Btw, Gorenaire is a really mean dragon =/

Halana, 57th Shaman
Tani 33rd Bardette
Paradigm 0, Gorenaire 1
SolusekRo

> -----Original Message-----
> From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:dean_kimes@...]
> Sent: Wednesday, November 08, 2000 9:50 AM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] LEHP!
>
>
> Bard songs will definitely break Monk FD. I can testify to
> this from both
> sides, my monk has died several times as mobs stood over me
> ignoring me and
> my sliver of health only to have a bard pulse accel and get
> smacked. It
> does not stand you back up, it just breaks the feign.
>
> Kit
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Cranfill, Wendy [mailto:Wendy_Cranfill@...]
> Sent: Monday, November 06, 2000 12:51 PM
> To: 'eqbards@egroups.com'
> Subject: RE: [eqbards] LEHP!
>
>
> Wow MacGrough, that sounds like it would be pretty cool! At
> least they're
> working on it - although we've heard that before, haven't we....
>
> Also, I need some advice! Unlike many bards who seem to die
> a lot, I'm
> having the opposite problem, I'm killing party members :( Having some
> trouble with Monk FD and cleric slaughter. Somehow I'm walking away
> unscathed (still manage to kill myself fairly easily when soloing!).
>
> I was told that bard song doesn't bother monk FD but it seems
> when my monk
> friend FD, he dies reeeeally quickly. The cleric, seems I
> can't taunt off
> of him... and does DA keep bard song from hitting him -
> specifically selos
> :)
>
> Thanks!
>
> Tani "cleric killer" Kaat, 33rd Bardette
> Halana, 57th Shaman, tasty snack for Hoshkar!
> Paradigm
> Solusek Ro
>
> > -----Original Message-----
> > From: Donny Dane [mailto:ddane01@...]
> > Sent: Monday, November 06, 2000 12:41 PM
> > To: eqbards@egroups.com
> > Subject: Re: [eqbards] Has anyone else used these recently
> > and noticed?
> >
> >
> > Ok, had a chance to quiz GZ on the songs this weekend at
> > eqfest 2000 in
> > Houston, TX.
> >
> > Pixe and such, are being/have been changed, during the
> > patches that are
> > going live...he wasn't specific on it.
> >
> > LULLABYE WILL BE CHANGED!
> >
> > GZ: "Look for some VERY interesting things to be happening to
> > Lullaby soon"
> > GZ: "We have been thinking about bard mez, we didn't want
> > them to infringe
> > on the Enchanter role, as that is what Enchanters do best,
> > BUT we don't
> > think that giving bards some mez abilities will hurt"
> >
> > These are not exact quotes, but pretty close.
> >
> > MacGrough Mich'Rathe
> > Solusek Ro Wanderers
> >
> > p.s. One helluva weekend, even if it felt like being in the
> Karana's.
> > EQFest 2000 was a blast!
> > Check out eq.stratics.com and watch the official eq site for news!
> > Thanks Ron!
> > ----- Original Message -----
> > From: "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@...>
> > To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
> > Sent: Friday, November 03, 2000 2:17 PM
> > Subject: RE: [eqbards] Has anyone else used these recently

> > > Well, supposedly no. However the spdat.eff file did get

> > > weekend when I logged in. They can also change some spell
> > effects in the
> > > database without taking the servers down. I think this
> > might actually
> > have
> > > gone in with the last patch and may have either been
> > unintentional, or
> > they
> > > may be trying it out to see if they see any unbalancing
> > effects from it
> > > being live before they announce that it is live. That way
> > if they have to
> > > change it fewer people will notice.
> > >
